body:
Comment 3: 
The zeroing was intended as a partial step, on the way toward call site-specific bitmaps
saying which pointers were live. Once those bitmaps were in, much of the zeroing would
be deleted. But the call site-specific bitmaps are not ready, and the current large
amount of zeroing causes serious performance degradation (see CL 12616045 description),
so we have to back it out for the release.
